result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Dion Byrnes

records.addlTxt:
3:39 PM Defendant William Dion Byrnes appeared by video.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for William Dion Byrnes.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions counsel.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant was in custody and released September 30th, he did not get the notice.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant quashed

Atty Juech has no objection to reinstating the cash bond.

BY THE COURT:  Cash bond will be reinstated.

Atty Gumz asks for a Prelim to be set.
BY THE COURT:  Set Prelim
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:14 PM Defendant William Dion Byrnes not in court.  Attorney Rachel Roberge appeared by video for William Dion Byrnes.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
22TR904 tracking with 22CF83:
Atty Roberge states that the defendant is no longer in custody and they don't have a good phone number for him.  Atty Juech requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear and asks that the cash bond be forfeited.
Atty Roberge asks the court to hold on the ruling of the bond

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue. 
Court will hold open the request to forfeit the cash bond.

10:23 AM Defendant William Dion Byrnes appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for William Dion Byrnes.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
22TR904 tracking with 22CF83:
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelim.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands and agrees with the waiver of time limits.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Court confirms address.
Status hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on October 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:56 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant William Dion Byrnes not in court.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for William Dion Byrnes. 
Atty Gumz states that the defendant is in Jefferson County Jail.

BY THE COURT:  Court will reset.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription, Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol, and no operation of Motor Vehicle without a valid DL.

3:15 PM Defendant William Dion Byrnes appeared by video from the Marquette County Jail. Attorney Anderson appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond.   Attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court finds probable cause for Riverside purposes. Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands. 
Attorney requests $500.00 cash bond with conditions; *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription, *Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol, and no operation of Motor Vehicle without a valid DL. Attorney Anderson requests a signature bond but does not object to other conditions.
BY THE COURT: Court sets a $500.00 cash bond with the requested conditions.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
